div.div: Governor Ducey and Superintendent Hoffman announced today that they will extend school closures to the end of the school year. Great Expectations Academy will continue to academically engage students at this time. We will post updates as we move forward. We appreciate your patience as we work through this unprecedented time.
div.p: PLEASE NOTE: You should have been contacted by your child’s teacher either by phone or email. Please call the school office at (520)399-2121 if they have been unable to reach you.

div.class: wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-lg-8 vc_col-md-7 vc_col-xs-12

div.p: Welcome to Great Expectations Academy! We are a tuition free K-8 public charter school located in Sahuarita, Arizona. GEA opened its doors to students in 1999, and since then we have strived to offer quality education with a strong focus on literacy and the arts. We offer small class sizes for a more learning-friendly atmosphere, and strong parent involvement and support. All of our teachers are Highly Qualified. We are also home to award-winning bands, performing arts and full music program, and special education programs.

p.b: ALL ITEMS ON THIS AGENDA ARE OPEN FOR DISCUSSION AND POSSIBLE ACTION, INCLUDING REPORTS AND ACTION ITEMS
1. Call to Order/Pledge of Allegiance/Moment of Silence/Roll Call

div.p: Pursuant to A.R.S. 38-431.01.G, the board may allow individuals from the public to address the Board. Comments shall be limited to issues within the jurisdiction of the Board. The Board shall not discuss or take legal action on matters raised during an open call to the public unless the matters appear on this agenda for discussion and legal action.

p.b: 5. Consent Agenda – All items on this agenda will be considered by a single motion with no discussion, unless requested otherwise by a board member.

div.p: Posted: October 14, 2019 Great Expectations Academy Administration Office/www.geageckos.org

div.div: 28 - Kinder Promotion 9 am, 8th Grade Promotion 1 pm

div.p: In accordance with A.R.S. §15-189.05, as added by Laws 2018, Ch. 285, §3, a school’s budget shall include the prominent display of the average salary of all teachers employed by the school for the budget and prior years, and the increase in the average salary of all teachers employed by the school for the budget year reported in dollars and percentage. Schools must also prominently post this information on their website home page separately from its budget.
